title: PFL 2019, Playoffs 2 weigh-in results: All fighters make weight
text:
It’s all systems go for the second week of the PFL playoffs.

All 16 fighters for Thursday’s event at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas hit their marks as the lightweight and featherweight tournaments get under way.

The competitors will look to fight twice in a single night and earn their way to the PFL 2019 Championship, which takes place Dec. 31, where playoff winners will take home $1 million prizes.

Quarterfinal-round winners will then move on to the semifinals, which will also take place on Thursday night. Semifinal winners will then advance to the finals, which will be held on the Dec. 31 event.

Both divisions feature competitors who will look to defend their 2018 crowns: Natan Schulte at lightweight and Lance Palmer at featherweight.

MAIN CARD (ESPN 2, 10:30 p.m. ET):

Akhmed Aliev (155.4) vs. Rashid Magomedov(155.2) — lightweight quarterfinal

Islam Mamedov (155.2) vs. Loik Radzhabov (154.4) — lightweight quarterfinal

Chris Wade (155.4) vs. Nate Andrews (155.6) — lightweight quarterfinal

PRELIMINARY CARD (ESPN+, 8 p.m. ET):

Natan Schulte (155.2) vs. Ramsey Nijem (155.8) — lightweight quarterfinal

Lance Palmer (145.8) vs Alexandre Almeida (145.0) — featherweight quarterfinal

Alex Gilpin (145.8) vs. Andre Harrison (145.2) — featherweight quarterfinal

Movlid Khaybulaev (145.4) vs. Daniel Pineda (145.4) — featherweight quarterfinal

Luis Rafael Laurentino(145.8) vs. Jeremy Kennedy (145.6) — featherweight quarterfinal
description: The lightweight and featherweight playoffs kick off on Thursday night.
